alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County South Coast; Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 02 at 11:31AM PST until January 03 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Abnormally high tides between 7.0 and 7.5 feet are expected to bring minor tidal overflow. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast, Santa Barbara County Central Coast, Santa Barbara County South Coast, Ventura County Coast and Los Angeles County Coast. * WHEN...During times of high tide each morning, ranging from 6 am to 10 am today to between 7 am and 11 am on Monday. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is likely around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County South Coast; Ventura County Coast
